awd_abstract_narration: Students in organic chemistry and in special problems courses in                scientific research are doing experiments in the ultraviolet and                visible region of the spectrum.  Students are gaining experience  with          their own spectra of organic compounds for spectra structure                    correlations and learning to operate a modern, programmable, computer-          directed spectrophotometer equivalent to those used in industry and             national laboratories.  The students are doing experiments such as the          measurement of the spectra of aniline, the anilinium cation, and                nitrobenzene. They are then considering the displacement and                    enhancement of absorption bands in the spectrum due to the structural           substitution of the amino group on the aromatic ring, the disappearance         of the shift and enhancement when the amino group is converted to the           anilinium cation, and the appearance of additional bands when the               structural change involves substitution of a nitro group on the benzene         ring.                                                                                                                                                           The grantee is matching the award from non-Federal sources.
